description: With the release of Google Play services 7.8, Google added new Mobile Vision APIs, which include a new Face API that finds human faces in images and video better and faster than before.
title: Face Detection in Google Play services

description: What do Effective Java items look like through the eyes of an Android developer?Fragmented podcast introduces the very first of these venerable “Items”: Consider providing static factory methods instead of constructors.
title: Effective Java for Android developers : Item 1

description: JSON is lightweight and great. But if you need even more performance you can use Flatbuffers. FlatBuffers is an evolution of protocol buffers that includes object metadata. In this post you'll learn the basics and how to use them in your app.
title: FlatBuffers in Android

description: Iconify is a cool little library to manage icons in your Android app. This post gives a little introduction and the source code is available on GitHub.
title: Iconify just got a lot better

description: Here's a short tip from Google on how to deal with changes in Android M's permissions.
title: How to deal with permission denial on Android M

description: Very few developers are lucky enough to be able to specify minSdkVersion="21" and use arcMotion Scene transitions. Mark Allison shows a really neat way to get very similar behavior back to API 11 (Honeycomb) which is almost as easy.
title: Curved Motion – Part 2

description: With the release of Google Play services 7.8 Google added new Mobile Vision APIs which provides the Barcode Scanner API to read and decode a myriad of different barcode types quickly, easily and locally.
title: Barcode Detection in Google Play services

description: Game Programming Patterns is a collection of patterns the author found in games that make code cleaner, easier to understand, and faster. Here's the free online version.
title: Game Programming Patterns

description: In this post you'll learn how to use the CoordinatorLayout to create behavior that will provide easy quick return functionality.
title: Quick return with CoordinatorLayout

description: In this post you'll learn how to include a private library via gradle from Bitbucket.
title: Publish with Gradle on Bitbucket

description: In this post by Marco Uberti you'll learn how to mock an AsyncTask without external mocking libraries like Mockito or PowerMock.
title: How to mock Android AsyncTask without mocking libraries

description: Google recently announced the release of their cross-platform BLE Beacon format. In this post the guys from Ribot Labs took a look at it and show you how to use this new API to manage your beacons.
title: Proximity Beacon API

description: Check out Ship.io for easy cloud CI for native Android apps. Build, test & deploy across multiple platforms & devices. Ship supports Gradle, the latest Android OS & more. Special $100 credit for our Android Dev Weekly friends. Enter promo code androiddevweekly after signing up!
title: Automate CI Builds and Tests for Your Apps

description: Cross platform meets native app performance with Intel® INDE. Save time, code natively and integrate tools into your preferred IDE. The Intel® Integrated Native Developer Experience (Intel® INDE) provides tools, support and IDE integration for apps on Intel® Architecture. Free download.
title: Develop Faster with Intel® INDE

description: Whether you're looking for a new job or just testing the water, Hired is there for you. In 1 week you'll get 5+ offers from top tech companies around the US and UK. Want to learn more? Check out Hired today!
title: Meet 2,000+ companies in one week!

description: Google says this is Hangouts' update to material design, but what exactly does that mean for the app? There's more here than just a new FAB, so Liam Spradlin takes a closer look at some of the notable design changes in Hangouts 4.0.
title: A Closer Look At The Design Of Hangouts 4.0

description: We are building PSPDFKit for Android using RxJava & C++ 14. It's a challenging project that is used in many apps and there's plenty of work to be done. We have a talented team, who enjoy the benefits of working in a remote environment. If you're up for a challenge, send us your resume.
title: Android Engineer - Help us build an SDK

description: Nice curated list of Android testing frameworks.
title: Awesome Android Testing

description: ReactiveNetwork is an Android library listening network connection state and change of the WiFi signal strength with RxJava Observables
title: ReactiveNetwork

description: Hugo Visser has published an update to android-apt, a gradle plugin that assists in working with annotation processors in combination with Android Studio.
title: android-apt 1.7 released

description: UI form validation library for Android.
title: Android Saripaar

description: A Material Design themed ShowcaseView for Android.
title: MaterialShowcaseView

description: Library that implements the floating action button to sheet transition from Google's Material Design documentation. It can be used with any FAB library on Android 4.0+ (API levels >= 14).
title: MaterialSheetFab

description: Android fillable progress view working with SVG paths. This is a nice option too if you want to create an interesting branding logo for your app.
title: Android Fillable Loaders

description: A sample application created to test, explore and demonstrate the Proximity Beacon API.
title: WatchTower

description: LayoutCast is a Android Studio plugin to cast every change in your Java source code or resources (including library projects) to your phone or emulator within 5 sec, without restarting your application. (Currently Mac only)
title: LayoutCast

description: Dan Lew chats with Chiu-Ki about themes and styles while surrounded by Android plushies!
title: Android Dialogs: Dan Lew
